website_summaries.verdict: An attractive retail price point makes the Outland backpack a good choice for students and travelers on a budget. Durability is an issue, but many users only have short term needs for backpacks.
pros: Will fold into central compartment for easier storage
Works equally well as a carry on, a book bag or travel bag
cons: Construction material may not hold up in hot weather
Seams can fail under moderate stress

website_summaries.verdict: A no-fuss, lightweight choice, but there are better options for more serious hikers.
pros: Exceptional storage space, including handy pockets in the front, helps distance this pack from competitors
cons: Some owners wish for a more durable model

customer_reviews.title: Did my research and this bag has worked out great
customer_reviews.text: Ive been hiking with this bag over the last few weeks. I like it because its rather large for a collapsable bag and has a lot of pockets. When I am not using it it stow it away in its own pouch -which is sewn in. A big plus for me because I always lose those storage bags.
customer_reviews.author: David Larson

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: i bought this bag a week ago for my international trip. Sorry to say, but i'm very disappointed. I only used this bag few days, i was trying to empty the bag and surprisely found out the inside liner at the top has fallen! you can peel it off as small pieces. I felt so misguided by the grading comments.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this bag 5 months ago and the inside ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag 5 months ago and the inside lining/coat is crumbling and falling apart all over my things. I tried to contact the seller but I could not find any website/email to claim the "warranty."
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it! Broken after one-time use!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for my travel in South America and the pocket was ripped off the first day then the carrier straps ripped off after the second use. I only put my passport, mini-wallet and cellphone! It's not worth-it even for a one-time use as it can easily ripped off. Wish I could get my money back. I thought I could use it for the whole 2months traveling but ended up buying local backpack in Bolivia and it was more durable and costs much less than this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Rodina

customer_reviews.title: Nice size; quite sufficient water bottle pockets
customer_reviews.text: I received the 33L size today. Obviously, this backpack does not have any structure or support; but the straps are comfortable, easy to adjust, and I think it will serve my purposes well. Some reviews mentioned the inadequate water bottle holders - they are quite sufficient - they come up 3/4 of the way up my contigo16 oz mug and almost cover my toddlers nalgene (see picture). The material reminds me of a crinkly rain jacket, but supposedly it is very durable. I received an email from W&A stating their lifetime warranty with a link to report any issues. I will update this review if I run across any disappointments with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: sarahdoc

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a packable, waterproof backpack for my trip to Brazil and this was perfect! I wore it while hiking through the jungle in Iguassu Falls, where weather was unpredictable, and it kept all my belongings dry. At one point, I was able to fit a change of clothes, sunscreen, towel, and a bunch of other items. I liked the smaller pockets for items that needed to be easily accessible. The price point is great and it didn't take up any room in my luggage. I also used it later in my trip as an extra bag for souvenirs! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: LindsayNK9

customer_reviews.title: Looks good in the photo, but piece of c**p
customer_reviews.text: I bought a similar outlander bag 3 years ago--in bright orange. It held up well during extensive travel overseas. I wanted a black one in same style, but this one is a disappointment.. The material is fragile, stiff friable- like it's been exposed to heat or UV and is about to crack. The zipper on the small front compartment was opened in the middle, I was able to rethread it, but wonder if it will hold. My mistake not to examine the bag until I was ready to leave for my trip. Too late to return it, too late to order something else. Have to say, sadly the quality of merchandise sold on Amazon lately has declined. No quality control.
customer_reviews.author: NEV

customer_reviews.title: Travel light
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Fit all my clothes for a 5 day vacation. Very comfortable straps on my shoulders. I even fit my Skechers sneakers in the middle zipper. Attached photo shows my blue Outlander backpack with my girlfriend's very large luggage that had to be checked in at airport. It was funny.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe the hype
customer_reviews.text: Currently on the 3rd day of our Costa Rica trip, and with light use (clothes, 2 towels) the seams of the bag are already coming apart. You get what you pay for. Unfortunately, I don't know of any brands that offer better quality. I bought this on the thousands of good reviews, choosing to believe that the poor reviews were the exception... I can attest that they are not.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lam

customer_reviews.title: Light enough for a senior hiker
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a spring chicken anymore but at age 71, I'm still pretty active. I felt it was an honor when my 40ish friends invited me to hike The Walls of Jericho trail in northern Alabama with them. The Outlander backpack was light and just right for me to carry everything I needed for myself and my dog, Willie, to complete the 7 plus miles and thousand foot descent round trip. Willie and I can hardly wait until spring so we can continue joining the young folks in the great outdoors!
customer_reviews.author: Iris Hamlin

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for travel
customer_reviews.text: Great packable backpack for travel. I purchased this for my trip to Mexico and it poured rain but my items stayed nice and dry. Great that it packs up to small and I can bring it out when I need to. Holds a lot of items.. The material is thin so I would not pack anything that sensative like a camera unless you have it in a case. But for shopping or going to the beach and packing your items in the backpack to help you be handsfree this is great.
customer_reviews.author: dynomite

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful - Warranty is Elusive or Non-existent
customer_reviews.text: Great looking pack that fell apart inside within a month. The interior waterproof coating started falling apart with minimal use. When we tried to contact the seller, we got zero response even though their email said to respond by sending a reply.
customer_reviews.author: Kaimuki

customer_reviews.title: Nice backpack but the quality is subpar
customer_reviews.text: It really came in handy for my vacation. But I just got this last week before leaving & its already showing signs of wear & tear. I wanted to give this 5 stars with a good review because I did like it but not with the handle coming apart already. It's very annoying when buy something and it starts deteriorating so quickly. Please see the pictures I have attached. I returned it back to Amazon & got a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier

customer_reviews.title: The perfect backpack!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is like my Mary Poppins bag. Every time I would take things out people look at me like HOW did you fit all that in there?! On my 5 week trip throughout SE Asia this backpack was a game changer.. A few things I loved: - Super light bag and collapses to the size of a small rectangle - Straps are VERY comfortable even when bag is full - Perfect amount of zippers for organizing - Water bottle pockets on sides are stretchy so I was able to hold umbrellas etc in there - Straps adjust easily and do not come undone despite the simple design I would recommend this bag to anyone, it is a fantastic buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Economical and effective
customer_reviews.text: I have been very happy with this bacpack. I have had it many months and have used it on many occasions from hiking through the woods, to trips to the zoo, and as a carryon for vacations. It is also nice to throw it in your luggage in case you want a pack at your final destination. I used it while at the Grand Canyon to hold my camera, lunch, some snacks and a light layer of extra clothing
customer_reviews.author: john van hoorn

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made, unravels after 3rd use.
customer_reviews.text: I very rarely leave negative reviews, but this one deserves it. 3rd time taking the backpack out of the house, lightly loaded and the seam on the strap comes undone, rendering it useless. I have had its counterpart from HikPro for over 2 years and it's still functional. This one is poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for Any Adventurer
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a great purchase for a traveler! This backpack made it through wind, rain, 90 degree weather, 40 degree weather, up and down mountains, through cities, & on trains, planes, and buses all in one week! It fits a lot more than you would think...I constantly had a rain coat, blanket, 3 books, food, make-up, and docs in it & could have easily doubled all of these items.
customer_reviews.author: linco9

customer_reviews.title: incredible small!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the larger 33 size after reading several reviews, hoping to use it for a carry-on so I wouldn't have to pack a checked bag for a short trip...this is smaller than a kids backpack size!! I am SO disappointed...and now that I've unpacked it from its handy bag, I cannot get it back in its folded up compartment, so I cannot return it...guess I'll use it in the car for a small back-up bag, but worthless for what I had purchased it for
customer_reviews.author: jev

customer_reviews.title: material dries and leaves it on your stuff
customer_reviews.text: I just got back from my 3 month backpacking trip. This daypack did it's job in being light weight, handy, and packable. However after the first 2 weeks of use the zipper got stuck and I could not fix it. No problem, I'll zip one way. After 2 months of weekly use, the material inside started falling apart and drying out and would leave red residue on all the items that were stuffed in there. =( I've tossed it since.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Chen

customer_reviews.title: Nice backpack for my trip to Greece
customer_reviews.text: I received the back pack very quickly as promised. I am currently using it on a trip to Greece. It works well for carrying items with me to the beach, on the plain and short little day trips. The pack is very light weight and the straps are comfortable. It holds quite a bit of stuff. I would recommend the larger pack if you want to be able to fit many items in it. The large one is about the size of a regular pack and is not at all too large. It is so light that the extra room if not needed is no problem and it is nice to have extra room when that is needed as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for travel
customer_reviews.text: I chose this bag after spending a lot of time online examining the specs and reading reviews of a huge array of foldable backpacks. I chose the Outlander in part because it was so well reviewed, but also because it has more zipper compartments than most--two on the outside and one on the inside. When I first pulled it out of the pouch, it looked quite small. After putting in 6 tops (including a fleece one) there was still a lot of room yet to fill up without it looking huge and bulky (and possibly not being accepted as a "personal item" comparable to a purse or laptop bag on airlines). In short, I'm extremely pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: cheshire calhoun

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight pack for walks or hikes when you want to bring jacket and water or snacks. I also use it when I walk to the grocery store. Lots of pockets, great for id & credit card, as well as a mask, hand sanitizer and clorox wipes that we have to take everywhere now. You can't pack too much in it and it has no form so odd shapes can feel a bit lumpy on your back or sag. But overall I love this bag and would recommend to anyone looking for a light packable pack! I might even get another (for no reason except they are just so great!)
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great daypack for backpacking trips
customer_reviews.text: This works well as a daypack for backpacking trips (ie, use your giant backpack and set up camp, then take this little guy out for day hikes from camp). I like that it folds into a compact shape, so it's easy to pack within my backpack. It is adequately comfortable for light loads. Obviously, for a long hike or heavy load, I'd want to use a pack with more support, but this does the trick for dayhikes and packs nicely in my Osprey 65 backpack. I've only used it for a few days, so I can't speak to the longterm durability, but so far it seems well-constructed.
customer_reviews.author: AC/BC

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great diaper bag!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a new diaper bag and liked the idea of a backpack - but was not willing to spend $70+ for a bulky, box-like diaper bag backpack. This was exactly what I was looking for! It makes a great diaper bag - it's super light weight and I can wear loaded up while I push the stroller. It is really comfy and because it's a lightweight material it doesn't make my back hot. I fit the following in the bag and have room to spare: several diapers, diaper wipes/cream, hand sanitizer, first aid kit, extras clothes for me and baby, nursing cover, changing pad, pacifier, toys, burp clothes, washcloth, and blanket.
customer_reviews.author: AB10

customer_reviews.title: held a lot and was comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: Used the backpack during our hikes in Rocky Mountain national park...held a lot and was comfortable to wear! I'm buying a second one for my husband!!! Great backpack!!!☺️
customer_reviews.author: tami tobin

customer_reviews.title: Outlander Ultra Lightweight backpack is truly lightweight but still durable.
customer_reviews.text: So glad we purchased the Outlander Ultra lightweight 20L backpack. Super lightweight but held up well. No problem with zippers, seams or straps. Used the backpacks for a 17 day trip to Europe and had absolutely no issues. The 20L size was perfect. Was a little concerned when I opened the package because it looked small but once we started loading it up with stuff it was remarkable. It held everything including windbreakers, snacks, paperwork, phones, chargers.. While on a train in Europe another traveler noticed our packs and immediately went online to Amazon and ordered himself one for his next trip. BTW I wouldn't consider this backpack waterproof but fine in a light drizzle.
customer_reviews.author: fleathinks

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Coated Lining Frayed from Day One!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this foldable backpack for over a year but started using it just 6 months ago. While the bag itself is durable, the lining, which looks like some sort of a coating, is nothing but. It started fraying from day one and still hasn't stopped. It's a nuisance and at times embarrassing. The cheap lining peels off and gets into all the contents. It's a pain to get them off. I frequently empty the bag, clean out the contents and shake off all the droppings by holding it upside down outdoors. I don't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tango

customer_reviews.title: This bag has seen me through thick and thin
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this bag to use for when I volunteered at conventions such as Anime Expo. It holds all the essentials and has convenient zipper compartments, not the mention the super comfortable straps. I have since used this bag as a day pack for hikes and other recreational activities. This bag has also saved the day after I got whiplash from a car accident and needed a lighter backpack to carry all of my school essentials for college. My one complaint is that the inside shiny coating has started to rub off, but that's not a big deal for what it has seen me through. Bottom line, if you are looking for a day pack, just get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Hamtj

customer_reviews.title: Tough little back pack with a great little price
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the smaller back pack. It's a great size for travel. I will use it in place of my purse on casual trips. The quality is much better than I had expected. Very pleased with the quality for the price. I used this back pack to complete the 26.2 mile Bataan Memorial Death March in New Mexico. It is very light weight and even with it being 89 degrees in the desert I did not get any chafing from the back pack. It was very comfortable and held everything I needed. The straps are made of mesh and some other very light weight material.
customer_reviews.author: Warrior Woman

customer_reviews.title: Great for day trecking
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect. I used it on my trip to Ireland to hold things during the day trips. Very durable. Still looks great after washing. It's not waterproof but will keep things dry in a lite rain. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi Milligan

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for price.
customer_reviews.text: To help people with sizes. I bought a 33L it holds 3 gallons of milk comfortably. I recently bought a 20L, it will hold 2 gallons of milk but it is a tight fit and you kind of have to force the zip closed. The weight and cost difference is negligible between the two. I made a mistake an ordered the 20L one, I am going to re-order the 33L one. I hardly ever use all the space, but it is better to have too much than too little. Oh and both packs will easily zip back into the travel pouch so neither takes up much room when stored.
customer_reviews.author: H. L. Cowman

customer_reviews.title: Nice size for travel.
customer_reviews.text: I had this backpack stowed away in my suitcase until I arrived at my destination. I wanted something lightweight that I could use shopping, carry water (we were in a very hot/humid climate) and at the beach. I used the small inside pocket to keep my wallet. The outside pockets to hold water bottles were handy. They seemed to hold a smaller water bottle more securely. It was just the right size for day trips (eg: swimsuit/travel beach towel/sunscreen with room to spare). I plan on using it on day hikes. The shoulder straps were easy to adjust. I would buy this product again. It would make a great gift.
customer_reviews.author: bottletree123

customer_reviews.title: Small one doesn't hold enough
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice, lightweight backpack; however I ordered the smaller version since reviewers said it held all essentials for a day hike, and that the larger one would hang too low. I got it. No way is the smaller one going to take you from a warm day to a cool night. I would not be able to put a fleece jacket, hat, mittens, scarf as well as wallet, camera, snacks & other assorted trekking or touristing necessaries in the smaller one. The larger one hangs just fine on me or my husband and fits what one may need if you want to be prepared on a day's adventuring.
customer_reviews.author: Tumblewind

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel bag
customer_reviews.text: I love these packs! In fact, this is the third I've ordered. I first got the smaller green one for myself, then the larger orange one for my husband. For an up-coming adventure I have now bought a larger green one for myself. These packs feel and carry like a full-structured day pack, but there is no bulk at all. We don't fold ours, but just pack it flat in our suitcases and it takes up no space. We always take them when we travel as well as use them for short adventures around home. Great size, great colors, no bulk.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Vz

customer_reviews.title: Buy it - you can’t beat the functionality and price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a second one of these backpacks this week. The first one still looks brand new - our son just wanted one for himself. This makes the perfect hiking backpack. It is super lightweight so you don’t spend your energy carting around a huge pack for a day trip. Fits water bottles, snacks, sweatshirts...really everything you need. Can’t say enough about how much use we’ve gotten out of this pack and it doesn’t show a stitch of wear. Will actually be purchasing one more this week so that we all have a pack. The fact that it’s so economical is icing on the cake!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: packs small, holds a lot, well-made
customer_reviews.text: Great, packable backpack for day hikes, running errands, etc. Comfortable and well-constructed. See picture of the LARGER SIZE OPTION in blue, loaded down with produce and still with room to spare (5 grapefruit, 8 tomatoes, 12 bell peppers and 4 avocado). POSITIVE UPDATE: My wife and I took two of these on a 3-week trip around South America as our day excursion packs. On and off, moto-taxis, boat ferries, bicycles - with ZERO rips, fraying, or the like. And we often over-stuffed them! I'm totally confident in the quality of these packs.
customer_reviews.author: J3R3MY

customer_reviews.title: Great packable backpack!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it extensively yet but it is a very nice addition to a much larger pack in case you don't want to haul your 5.11 Rush pack everywhere, like I do. Folds and keeps itself very compact... not tiny, but enough to stay out of the way until you need it. Material is pretty decent too... I was afraid it would be cheap-feeling but it's not bad. I would trust my camera in this. Obviously, with a packable backpack you're not going to get support stays or great straps, but as a compact, deployable extra pack, this serves pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Ray B.

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight, functional backpack
customer_reviews.text: This is a very lightweight and cute backpack. I brought it with me on a week-long hiking vacation, and I really liked that it was so lightweight and had lots of storage compartments. The backpack is very useful for long hikes where you plan to carry a bunch of supplies but don't want to worry about the backpack itself weighing you down even more than the supplies already are. It also doesn't take up much space since it folds up into a small pack. One minor issue is that one of the mesh compartments for holding bottles tore a little and will need to be sewn up, so the construction isn't the best there.
customer_reviews.author: S. L.

customer_reviews.title: I have an Osprey 13 L that seemed like it was the same size and packs as much
customer_reviews.text: The 20 L felt really small. I have an Osprey 13 L that seemed like it was the same size and packs as much. Unless you really stuff the Outlander to the point where it’s about to explode, then maybe you get 20 L ??? I am really not happy about it and am thinking of returning it. I still need a medium size day pack but too much of a hassle to now get the Outlander 33L and not sure if it will work for me. I was very excited When I first got my 20 L product and could not wait to open it when I got it so overall very disappointed by my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie Chan

customer_reviews.title: Love these Outlander Ultra Lightweight Daypacks
customer_reviews.text: I use these for the beach, dog walking neighbors’ dogs and travel-to a point. (I have a very solid, secure day pack for heavy duty travel and security, airports, etc). But for those times during travel when I’m not as concerned re security, eg a night out or running around w very little, no credit cards maybe a little foreign currency, etc. and maybe just some water or incidentals, this is perfect. Has some zip pockets interior and exterior and sections. It washes well. I actually washed it several times. I have one for home use and one ea for my husband and I for travel moments. The variety of colors it comes in are fantastic. And it is light!
customer_reviews.author: Good Life

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I pack light...just this backpack for one month overseas. It is so lightweight, but also super sturdy, so I had no trouble jamming and cramming it full with the extra stuff I picked up along the way. The zippers are strong and trouble free. No question it fits as a "personal item" on the plane. And with weight restrictions for carry-on and personal items these days, I was glad not to waste any ounces of pounds with unnecessarily heavy fabric.
customer_reviews.author: RainhaMom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent foldable backpack!
customer_reviews.text: I love my backpack. My daughter has a different brand, which is ok, but I wanted to try a different brand because hers didn’t have pockets on the main part. This one has multiple. I wish the water bottle pockets were a little deeper. They are 7”. My bottles are 10” and my collapsible umbrella is 11”. Occasionally they fall out when I’m shifting my bag. However, I like the extra band on the bottle pockets, which help. I also like how light the backpack is. Even on hot days, my back doesn’t sweat. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Popp

customer_reviews.title: Best Diaper Bag ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have twins and when we were trying to find a diaper bag we decided just to get a regular bag that we could use later after kids. I wanted something lightweight that could collapse for travel but still had enough pockets for me to organize everything. I had an earlier version of this bag for over 3 years and I finally got a new one to replace it. It finally started getting a hole from where we grabbed it all the time heading out the door. I love this bag. It has gone through many trips, spills, and washings and still managed almost daily use for 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: travelgaltina

customer_reviews.title: Great Day Pack Perfect for Travel!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great backpack perfect for when you travel and need a place to put items you need to take with you or pick up along the way.I purchased two of them for a trip to Ireland and it really came in handy for us. It folds easily back in to a pouch which makes it easy to store back in luggage or in your car, etc. There are mesh pockets on the sides of it, which makes for a great place to put a water bottle, camera,. I love that the back pack comes in a variety of colors.
customer_reviews.author: Kimba Jay

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, not water proof, fits A LOT of stuff
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my backpack. It is light weight and does hold a ton of things. All the pockets are awesome. I wish that it was completely water proof though. I got caught in a Florida rain storm and even with an umbrella covering me and the backpack everything inside was soaked. Also the straps aren’t the most comfortable if you are carrying a small thing that has decent weight to it. Overall I love it though
customer_reviews.author: Israel M

customer_reviews.title: I checked the stitching straight away
customer_reviews.text: Once I determined there were no errant seems, I shoved it in my jacket pocket, and went shopping on my e-scooter, filling it with some canned goods and a big loaf of bread, and two big bunches of lacinato. This is a must-carry for PEV riders. You never know when the need arises, and it invariably does. If you want to carry some weight, just oversew the part where the shoulder straps meet the top of the enclosure. I can't think of a single thing I'd change about this little hold-all.
customer_reviews.author: W. Swanton

customer_reviews.title: Stitching defective & replacement
customer_reviews.text: After inspection of this backpack (and before using it) I found stitching defects so I contacted Amazon and got a re-order and instructions on shipping the defective bag back so this rating is related only to the bags--averaging a 1 star and 5 star review Another little thing-- the "free" carabiner was also defective but it was free-- I returned that with the bag. The replacement was fine no problems or defects. This is a lightweight bag which I wouldn't use for traveling (after my initial problems I wouldn't trust it to hold up) but okay for local use. Folds up nicely. Has been useful
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Beefy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for Hiking in Scotland!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this backpack for traveling in Scotland. It is super lightweight and packs very small, which is great for travel. Unfolded, you can fit A LOT in this! We packed hats, gloves, food, our SLR camera, and more in it and had room to spare. It is definitely not water proof, but it is water resistant. I'm sure you could spray it with a coating to make it more water proof. Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Jo

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little back pack
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and compact but roomy enough to stuff a sweater of sweatshirt. The two outside pockets that hold a water bottle come with an elastic band that stretches over the bottle to hold it in. That is bonus and I wish every back pack had that feature as I am forever losing water bottles out of my backpack. It has a nice little pocket for your wallet, cell phone, keys, or small items and a medium pocket for larger things. Very light weight and perfect for day trips.
customer_reviews.author: oldhippie

customer_reviews.title: Strap ripped after one trip
customer_reviews.text: This backpack isn't terrible, but perhaps I bought it for the wrong thing. I purchased it as something lightweight to take with me as an airplane carry-on. It's the perfect size to fit under the seat and has enough room for me to put in my tablet, documents, snacks, etc. I might have stuffed it a bit too full, however, as after one trip the top strap has almost ripped off. Since this pack is supposed to be useful for the outdoors I figured it would hold up to a bit of rough treatment. I could probably sew the strap back on, but I'm disappointed that it ripped on its first time being used.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Very light backpack!
customer_reviews.text: Great little backpack! I’ve had this one for 4 years. I’ve used it for toiletries when traveling, to carry books, used daily when I was on crutches for 2 weeks, and used it for the pool/beach when traveling. The backpack can hold many items; a towel, several sunscreens, books, wallet, phone, etc. I just started taking it to work on a daily basis. The only issue I’ve had is some fraying around one zipper on the outside of the bag which didn’t happen until at least 3 years of use. (See pictures) For the low cost, this is a great bag and very “packable” for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Kand2010

customer_reviews.title: NOT waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Update: I took my backpack out in the rain. I used an umbrella, but it got wet anyway. It wasn't a downpour, either. The water soaked right into the fabric. It didn't bead up at all. Inside the pack, there was water damage to my notebook. SO disappointed. My old Jansport is more waterproof than this. Previous post: Arrived folded up. Was very wrinkled. A few weeks later, still rumpled-looking. I can't tell you it's water-proof, I've been keeping it dry.
customer_reviews.author: S P

customer_reviews.title: Great portable backpack!
customer_reviews.text: We used this on a trip to Iceland recently and it was very handy! We were able to fit a good amount of things in the bag, and it was comfortable to carry. The smaller size worked better for us so when we walked, it didn't hit our bottom, it fit just right. there were several small pockets to organize our smaller items and when we traveled back home, it was very easy to fold back up and fit in luggage. We did get splashed with water a couple of times on a boat ride and nothing inside got wet, so that was a plus!
customer_reviews.author: Lana K. Levy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love that it is so lightweight and easy to pack into my bigger pack. It has Plenty of space for my need and it was durable during my walking trip across Spain. I carried a regular backpack during the day and packed the Outlander with my extra things so it could be forwarded by car every morning. So, No, it was never out on the trail per se. I am so glad that I had it and will take it on my next trip just in case I need a little (or a lot) extra space . It was my perfect pack.
customer_reviews.author: curlygirl

customer_reviews.title: Beware, the Zippers Open their Own
customer_reviews.text: I originally liked this backpack. It was good value and functional until I started losing items from the pack. Thought I was leaving zipper open, but on last use i checked that it was fully zipped up. Well, after a 30 min hike, pack was fully unzippered! Not very useful, if stuff is going to fall out. This is a Nov 6 update with some clarification and rating update. I still regularly use the backpack with no issues when I keep the zippers fully zipped in the down position.
customer_reviews.author: clifford lapetoda

customer_reviews.title: The perfect travel backpack for airlines like Spirit and Frontier
customer_reviews.text: The perfect travel backpack for airlines like Spirit and Frontier. I purchased the larger model and was able to use as my personal item on Frontier airlines. This backpack is all about efficiency vs. comfort. The fabric and straps are very thin and light. This will NOT be a comfortable backpack to do something like a hike with. If you are looking for a very thin and light travel backpack then this is perfect. Also great for going on trips where you'll be bringing back more than what you came with. It folds up super small, you can put in your suitcase, and fill this up for your trip back.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, sturdy, roomy, great pockets
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery. It’s very lightweight and the zippers and fabric appear to be sturdy. I’m going on a cruise and need a lightweight (so as not to add much weight to my luggage) day pack for taking bottles of drinking water and a couple layers of clothes with me on port excursions. This pack should do the trick. There are two nice sized zippered pockets on the outside plus two water bottle pockets on the outside. The stuff pocket ends up as a nice zippered pocket on the inside plus there’s a generously sized non-zippered pocket on the inside which could take 8.5” x 11” documents/notebooks, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Great value and perfect addition for my recent trip to Europe
customer_reviews.text: This was such a nice addition to my travels. I packed this in my larger Tortuga travel backpack on a recent trip to Europe and ended up using it everyday as a carrier for extra jacket, water, shopping items, etc., and it worked really well. No signs of damage yet. There are probably smaller and maybe slightly lighter-weight options out there, but this backpack has great pockets, waterbottle holder, and is super easy to fold up. From comparing it to other options on Amazon, I liked that this one seemed to hold its shape a little better than others, and it proved true when I used it. Couldn't ask for much for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ben S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for flights and hikes.
customer_reviews.text: Took this backpack on a 13 day tour of Scotland in Sept. and stuffed it to the max. Even though I have back problems, this extremely light backpack was comfortable enough to wear on long lines at the airport or while hiking. It was equally comfy slung over my shoulder or worn as a backpack. It was also handy as my personal item on a flight to New Orleans over the holidays. This will be carried on all my trips.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne M.P.

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold up well.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag in purple for my daughter to take on hikes for her outdoor ed trip. She loved the look, as a parent that was a win. However when she returned the bag was falling apart. The top straps were unraveling and coming away from the base of the sack. She was really disappointed because she was hoping to use it again. At most she carried a notebook, water bottle, sweater and a sack lunch. I don’t know if it her bag just happened to be a poorly manufactured one, but this seems like unreasonable wear for such a small load.
customer_reviews.author: Evita V Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Held lots of stuff and very comfortable. Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Bought this backpack for husband and I to use in Hawaii on vacation. Took this bag all over with no problems. Held lots of stuff and very comfortable. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jamipher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent day pack
customer_reviews.text: I bought the smaller day pack in anticipation of a 6 week trip on the road. I wanted something lightweight to carry a hat, bottle of water, money and keys. The day pack performed admirably. It is remarkably sturdy for such a light bag. The zippers are quite heavy duty. The shoulder straps were mesh so not hot at all. Sometimes I packed a sweater too! All in all, I thought it was a terrific little day pack. I don't know how long it will ultimately last, but for 6 weeks, using it every day to tote stuff around, I was pleased every time I put it over my shoulder or on my back.
customer_reviews.author: LLC

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, comfortable, holds a lot
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack for travel! Packed up so small in its own bag, that it took up no room in my suitcase. It’s super light, & the straps are mesh so wearing it on my back in tropical temperatures didn’t raise my body temperature one bit. The straps are comfy too - when wearing it packed, it didnt dig in to my shoulders at all. I wore it through consistent light rain, & nothing I packed in it got wet. I was able to carry a lot in it - and used the bottle holders on the outside when hiking. GREAT purchase!
customer_reviews.author: LuluNlalaland

customer_reviews.title: Awesome compact backpack
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about this little backpack. First of I am not a backpack person. I never liked how most are bulky and overly thick. I'm a petite 5'2 female. I took this backpack to a trip to lake Tahoe. Mainly to carry my water, flip-flops power bars, swim suit, my wallet and sunblock. It was very light weight, I hiked everyday for good six hours plus. Took it to a kayak ride and my things stayed dry the whole time. Love everything about it. I didn't feel like I had anything on my back! This backpack will go with me to many more places! Don't hesitate to get one. It's also very well made!
customer_reviews.author: Califoriagal

customer_reviews.title: I use this as a purse
customer_reviews.text: I have a small bag and put it inside of this as a purse! Yes, I'm a person who takes everything but the kitchen sink wherever I go and am prepared for anything. When we go anywhere, you never know if we might stay for an extra day, too. (Well, at least until this stupid virus mess...) So this has been a great handbag for me because it can be as big or small as I need it to be. And if I am only going to the store, I simply take my tiny bag out of it and take off.
customer_reviews.author: Kaysette

customer_reviews.title: A terrific lightweight backpack.....
customer_reviews.text: I really really like this lightweight backpack. I purchased it for the purpose of heading to the hills and doing some hiking but have found it's just as useful at home. When the grandkids and i head out for a day at the park (or wherever), i toss my wallet in the backpack as well as snacks & necessities for the day - there's plenty of room and this backpack is so so light & comfortable to wear, much more so than my fairly comfortable cross body purse. An excellent purchase with an excellent price!
customer_reviews.author: lizzie

customer_reviews.title: Bad Strap Design Kept Falling Off Shoulder (had to Carry Bag)
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight and compact for traveling. Was excited to use while day traveling around the streets of Paris but ended up having to carry the bag. Everytime I put over my shoulders the bag would slip off after walking for awhile. Very frustrating. If I cinched the shoulder strap very tight (uncomfortable) they wouldn't fall off. However, this made it very cumbersome to remove quickly for jumping on and off the metro. Some type of connector across the chest would be great for me. Otherwise a good backpack. Maybe I just don't know how to adjust straps properly ????
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Raudabaugh

customer_reviews.title: Thoughtful Design
customer_reviews.text: Really good packable backpack. I like the toggled bungees provided as secondary restraints for whatever you put in the bottle pockets. Fairly water resistant as well--it's probably not going too keep your stuff dry drive an all-day downpour, but I walked a few blocks from my car to the ballet studio in a decent rainstorm and found my dance things were still dry when I arrived. Nice size, packs reasonably small, has a surprising number of handy pockets. Straps are quite comfortable under a fairly light load (haven't tried it schlepping heavy stuff).
customer_reviews.author: Asher Taylor-Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Backpack
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag it is the second one I have purchased. They made some good changes from the first one I bought . They added a large divider pocket to the big compartment and bungee cords on the outside side mesh pockets for holding a water bottle. I use this bag every time I travel. When we go into the city I throw it in my purse to have an extra bag to stuff our coats into or if we buy things. It’s a great little bag that holds a lot.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Took it everywhere.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it at the last minute. Threw it in my suitcase. Unfolded and used it for eight days on a tour. Perfect! Super light. Loved all of the pockets and water pockets. Carried from the top when we were not allowed to wear a backpack. The back pack straps are completely mesh- which was great for me.
customer_reviews.author: JanBo

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, very useful.
customer_reviews.text: Not being a backpack traveler, I didn’t know if I would use this. Are usually use a tote but this time decided to try something new. For a couple of weeks at a beach destination, I used it every day. Extremely lightweight, folds into a little pouch, very handy for light weight grocery shopping, market run, books, electronics, beach items and water. It’s not suitable for heavy duty use, but for my purposes, it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Travel Lover

customer_reviews.title: worked great for my trip
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my trip to Europe. I had 5 days in Italy before taking a cruise and I needed a carry-on that I could manage with my 24" rolling suitcase. This worked great for traveling through terminals, taking trains and subways. I have washed it in a machine. Stitching and zippers are fine. Although travel sites said not to wear backpacks as a tourist, we saw backpacks everywhere. (Just might have to be checked inside a church or museum.)
customer_reviews.author: Central Florida One

customer_reviews.title: Side pockets too short for water bottles
customer_reviews.text: I liked the backpack itself. Nice, packable, lightweight. However, I planned on carrying two water bottles with it on the outside pockets, to be easily reached without getting inside the pack. Not happening! The mesh pockets are WAYYYY too short. Even with the added bungee to strap it he bottle in, I got a maximin of 4 second before the bottle tipped and fell out. As soon as I sling it to my back to put it on....wham! Water bottle fell out. This was when the pack was full as well as lightly packed.
customer_reviews.author: Busia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for day hiking trips
customer_reviews.text: Great, light bag for hiking. NOT WATERPROOF! I didn't think it was, but if it rains, your stuff will get wet. I just bring Ziploc bags for things I'm worried about if it might rain. Perfect for hiking, light, and comfortable. That is what I bought it for. Perfect size. I light the extra pockets too. After several types and styles of bags and backpacks, I am very happy with this one. The straps don't cut into me. It's almost like you're not carrying anything. This size is a little bit smaller than a traditional backpack like a Jansport.
customer_reviews.author: Debra E. Grinaway

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these backpacks for our trip to Alaska. They were amazing. I bought the smaller one and it fit plenty in it for our day trips. The material is water resistant and the zippers held up very well contrary to some of the other reviews I read. Of course if you stuffed it to the brim and put tension on the seams I could see how there could be issues, but there weren't for us. I was skeptical that I could actually get the empty pack stuffed back into the pouch, but it was surprisingly easy. These backpacks met our needs and surpassed our expectations. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Great bag.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an international trip so I could put a few things in it as of my carry ons. I wanted something that could fit a lot of stuff inside, but didn't weigh much. This did the trick. I fit my small camera backpack, purse, scarf, book, and a few other odds and ends and had room to spare. The straps are not padded, so it's not super comfortable to wear if it's heavy, but it's not horrible either. It held up great on that trip and it seems very sturdy/well made.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight day pack
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag a lot more than I expected to. After a very wet Girl Scout camping trip, I needed to order a different day pack. I was deciding between this one and one at a retail store. They were both the same price, both red (the first aid kit is kept in my bag), and both lightweight. I chose this because it could fold into itself. I figured it would be lighter. It is lighter and at the same time bigger than the other! It is comfortable, has plenty of space, and dries quickly when it gets wet. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a lightweight day pack.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Farino

customer_reviews.title: Water resistant laminate sheds after moderate use. Otherwise still in good condition.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second outlander backpack we’ve bought. The first one started shedding the water resistant lining after 4 months of use. We hoped it was a freak occurrence that the company had fixed, but alas, the second one is shedding now after about 4 months. It makes a mess on whatever we put in it, particularly clothing. Has this problem been fixed and can we exchange for a newer edition?
customer_reviews.author: Tandem

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lightweight bag
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this purchase. I wasn't in a situation to know if the bag is water resistant, but it seems to be strong and well put together. I'm most impressed by how many pockets this has, which is something I thought I'd be forfeiting by getting this bag. It has as many pockets and places to organize my stuff just as a regular backpack. The comfortability is exactly as I expected for a foldable pack. It's not as comfy as my foam backpack straps, but it stays in place on my back and I didn't notice a lot of tension in my shoulders. I gave 5 stars because my expectations were exceeded by the quality and number of pockets.
customer_reviews.author: Alisa D.

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad product. But not great for hiking.
customer_reviews.text: This product is ok if you want affordability and the convenience of having something collapsible that you can store away once your done using it. But it’s not good for traveling itself. It is made of a thin material so anything that’s made of metal like hiking sticks, battery pack, knife etc you will feel it. Not much protection or padding at all. It’s not a bad product though it’s tough plastic type mesh that is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: eliceo correa

customer_reviews.title: Super backpack at a stunningly low price!
customer_reviews.text: I was SO pleasantly surprised with this backpack. I used it for two weeks walking around Maui and hanging out on the beach. It was perfect for snorkel gear, a chance of clothes, purchases - amazing how much stuff could fit and the water bottle holder was perfect. Much sturdier than I thought it would be. The angle of the bottom outside pouch and zipper is excellent for not letting anything slip out. So happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: LMB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for day trips.
customer_reviews.text: Carried items for day trips including food and drink, extra socks, rain gear, power banks, etc. Items never got damp even in pouring rain. Surprisingly comfortable. Does not cause a sweaty back. Not exactly stylish but for the price can't be beat. After many days of use there is no sign of wear. At this price you can stash one in your car and luggage for a utility bag. It folds neatly into a small inside pocket so takes minimal space.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Beckey

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel/On the Go Pack
customer_reviews.text: This is a super lightweight travel backpack. I got the 40 Litre one and it is very spacious. It is made of strong yet thin material and has held up through many adventures. It folds up super easily into a small pouch. It is an excellent pack to have if you go on any trip. The water bottle holders on the side are plenty spacious enough for my Nalgene and Hydroflask. Overall it's a super cheap and effective backpack. There is minimal back support and it is flimsy but that is what you get when you can fold it into a tiny bag 😀
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: packed pretty full, and it held up wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: Took this backpack on a day of hiking, packed pretty full, and it held up wonderfully. Almost no added weight from the backpack itself. I'll definitely take this traveling with me. The side pockets for holding bottles worked really well - some are too low and the bottle falls out - this has a stretchy cord to help keep it in. A little finicky to get stuffed back in the pocket (I love how this acts as an interior pocket when using the backpack), and it never looks quite as neat as when it arrived, but I'm not surprised or worried. Love the backpack. I'd highly recommend. I think I got the larger of the two.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gilson

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a backpack wearer. I bought 2 of these for me and my husband. Used on our trip. Bought it because of the reviews. Wasn't sure about the thinness of the material, but I just love this backpack! So many compartments and it's comfortable to wear. Holds a lot. It was the best backpack! So glad it is so lightweight. Looks great too! Can't say enough about it!
customer_reviews.author: Suzy

customer_reviews.title: Great little daypack, holds a lot of stuff!!
customer_reviews.text: For our purposes as a daypack on vacation this was perfect! We used it daily and it was able to hold everything we needed (a few diapers, wipes, snacks, water bottles, extra toddler outfits, phones, wallets, chapstick, etc.). It held a lot of stuff! And the pockets made it easy to keep everything organized. It was super lightweight and comfortable to carry all day. Easy to repack into its little pouch and throw into our suitcase. We used it every day of our trip and never had issues with zippers or fraying, but we were in San Diego with no extreme weather and we were just out around town not doing any intense hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Very light wait and roomy!
customer_reviews.text: When I received the product it was folded into a small pouch. I wondered if I would be able to get it back into the pouch. I was pleasantly surprised when I pulled out the rest of the backpack from the small pouch and it was extremely large and roomy. There are lots of places to put my items and water bottles. It's extremely lightweight. I'm not sure how long the nylon bag will last but I like it. And I was able to easily fit it back into the small pouch which makes a pocket inside the backpack when the pouch is empty.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is my second one to purchase... Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second backpack I have purchased. I use it for biking and took it to Disney. My husband liked it so much he has taken it over for his hiking! So I had to buy me another one. My daughter also has one. I love this backpack!
customer_reviews.author: geh25

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 3 of these backpacks. One of the smaller sizes and 2 larger. The second larger was mostly because I was afraid of not having the first one delivered in time. Regardless, I took 2 of them on vacation to Mexico recently and can not be more happy with them. Both sizes hold a ton, are super comfortable to wear and are lightweight. I was thinking of returning the extra large pack but because of how much I love them, I'm keeping it! I definitely recommend these backpacks. Oh, and they are easy to get back into the pouch for storing.
customer_reviews.author: Ragnhild Sollesvik

customer_reviews.title: Outlander Packable Handy Lightweight bag
customer_reviews.text: Although I haven't taken a trip yet to use this bag, I have done a trial packing. Looks like this will be very useful, lightweight and will do the trick. I never like to take any more than the barest of necessities and this bag hold all I would need. I would certainly recommend this bag for anyone who travels with minimalist items. Below are pictures of my bag loaded, trial packing. And a shot of what all I fit in it. Two pr pants, 2 pr. shoes, sox and underwear, sleep shirt, 3 shirts, toiletries, cashmere sweater, There is left over room in which I would put my watercolor kit *small and a scarf.
customer_reviews.author: msartiste4

customer_reviews.title: Amazing amazing and not $$$$
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing! When I opened the package I was thinking no way is this good quality. Boy was I wrong. I am full time college student and hard on my bags and books. I fit in 3 text books. My laptop and laptop sleeve. My planner and all of my personal junk I always think I need. Then I used the two side pockets for my drink and the other for my iPhone 6+. Which fit amazingly AND I can reach both while wearing the pack! I have recommended this to a friend and will for sure buy another one if I need to. But honestly this one is amazing. Love it. Soooooo much room.
customer_reviews.author: Elishansteph

customer_reviews.title: Not my first choice
customer_reviews.text: I read such great reviews for these bags and I needed something for travel. It is the worse back-pack I've ever purchased. First, the straps have NO padding, I had to carried this bag with all my stuff walking and sight seeing. It was killing my shoulders. Second, it has no base. I could not put something on the bottom without it poking my back, I had to put soft items on the bottom just to get that cushion/base to level things on top. The only thing good about this bag is it rolls up into a size of a 16 oz cup.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: So light weight I couldn’t believe it!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the construction of this pack. It’s not flimsy and ready to rip. The zippers are strong and sewn perfectly. Lots of pockets and the storing pouch makes an easy to get at mini pocket on the inside right at the top. Perfect for small items. I will use this for hiking and boating, car and plane travel. The well made slightly padded breathable easy to adjustable straps work well! The only thing I don’t like is that I didn’t buy a couple more while they were on the sale !
customer_reviews.author: Buying grandma

customer_reviews.title: Love this backpack!! Get it!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack. I didn’t think I could love a backpack but I do. Super light and comfortable and fits a surprising amount. I take it to kickboxing with my gloves and all my gear and can still fit some groceries in when I stop at the store on my way back from class. I wish I would stand up better on my lap but I think that’s also due to what I have in it. Feels really good on your shoulders. And I really like the burgundy color that I got. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: hlfinn

customer_reviews.title: This was perfect for my needs as it was very lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I went out of the country recently and needed a daypack that wouldn't take up a lot of room in my main luggage. This was perfect for my needs as it was very lightweight, took up very little room and was quite durable. I had my laptop, battery pack, chargers, snacks, and my water bottle. It held all of it just fine and other extra stuff. At first I thought it might rip because I was carrying so many things and the material seemed like a windbreaker, but it was quite strong. I bought a second one for my sister. Overall I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: So useful!
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this backpack in a pinch and we both love it! We have had it for several years and it has held up very well. I mostly use it everyday in Provence France where we are now living and using the bus as our main means of transportation. Its my favorite backpack since it is SO light , has 3 seperate pockets and "stretches" to accomodate my purchases. The only thing that i would suggest is that the company use a smoother material for the handle strap. I ended up putting smooth wide tape over it and that works.
customer_reviews.author: Annick

customer_reviews.title: nice backup storage
customer_reviews.text: I keep this bag inside my bike pannier in case I have extra stuff I need on my work commute, so it doesn't get heavy use, just occasional times. It's a tight fit folding it back into its built-in storage pocket, so I mostly keep it unfolded, either near the bottom or top of my pannier. It's fairly roomy, but I wouldn't call it extra spacious; I could only zip it partway closed after picking up a package from an Amazon locker on my way home; it was enough though that it didn't fall out.
customer_reviews.author: bargain hunter

customer_reviews.title: Super backpack for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the blue 25L for my rather tall 4 year old to travel with on vacation so that she could help carry the load. It was a tad big for her, but we filled it up and she still managed great. I like that she can grow into it, and that any of us can use it as a small backpack. The attached pouch it comes with is also handy for storing it when not in use or packing it with your other luggage for day trips.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Terrific backpack but not for short waisted wonen
customer_reviews.text: Loved this light handy backpack. It was well made and I liked the 2 roomy outside front pockets and dual water bottle holders. It also has pole holders which would be very useful. Unfortunately I returned it only because I'm so short in the back and another fit more comfortable when loaded. This great little backpack held as much as a larger 35L with room to spare. It is ultra light and well made. It just wasn't going to be comfortable for me on my lower back. A great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A functional masterpiece, at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: I knew I was in need of a day pack. Something to get me through the day. On quick trips around town, to work, or the supermarket. But it also had to be super light-weight, and very budget friendly. So I'm glad I found this pack. It far exceeded my expectations and has been an essential item on my 6 month stay in europe. Notes: 1. It manages to hold in quite a lot for it's small size, yet weighs absolutely nothing. 2. If you're a big dude/lady buy a bigger size pack. The 20L looks small on me, and I'm kinda average sized.
customer_reviews.author: El Monks

product_meta.title: Outlander Ultra Lightweight Packable Water Resistant Travel Hiking Backpack Daypack Handy Foldable Camping Outdoor Backpack
feature_bullets: Water-resistant and DURABLE. The backpack is made from highly rip and water-resistant nylon fabric, which provides strength and long-lasting performance, with minimal weight. Stress points are reinforced with bar tacking for increased longevity.
COMPACT. Folds into zippered inner pocket to fit anywhere. Unfolds from pocket to backpack. A must-have on any trip.

LIGHTWEIGHT(0.46 Pounds) and ROOMY(20 Liters). A true space saver. Stuff the bag into its own pocket for storage and unzip it when you reach your destination. Avoid overweight baggage charges by simply unfolding it from your luggage

MULTIPLE COMPARTMENTS. Features a classic shape with several pockets for storage and organization.This backpack has a roomy main compartment,two front zipper pockets to hold small accessories, one internal zippered security pocket for valuable items

NEW VERSION Includes a carabiner clip so you attach things or clip it to things.Ultra-light. Ultra-durable. Ultra-awesome. The backpack is perfect for day-to-day use or occasional travel, and great gift for everyone.
